summary: This is an email chain from April 7, 2021, discussing scheduling a meeting regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and referencing legal documents including a motion to intervene, Maxwell's public statement, and a defamation complaint. The email is from a Deputy Chief in the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of allegations in a motion to intervene and a defamation suit; her public statement denying allegations is mentioned.

events.title: Proposed Maxwell Meeting
events.description: A meeting is proposed to discuss the Maxwell case, with the team available on April 14 at 4:30 PM.

events.title: Alternative Meeting Date
events.description: The team is available anytime on April 21 for a meeting regarding Maxwell.

events.title: Alternative Meeting Date
events.description: The team is available in the afternoon of April 23 for a meeting regarding Maxwell.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email references a motion to intervene in a CVRA case that includes allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell and others.
It mentions Maxwell's public statement, issued through a PR person, denying allegations and calling them 'obvious lies'.
A defamation suit complaint is referenced as one of three key documents for the case.
The sender indicates a need to redact components of documents that include 'erroneous legal conclusions that the NPA covered Maxwell'.
The email is sent by a Deputy Chief in the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
